* Zyber looked through the blinding snow, but saw nor smelled any game.
But then she remembered jusy why she had journeyed all the way to the 
south...to find game in the first place.
She looked left and then right, still seeing nothing other then pure snow.
A sigh escaped her muzzle. This was turning out to be a tougher day then she 
expected.
However, she couldn't just leave that bot in her cave either, slag knew that 
he could get a cold or even worse without being under her watchful eye.
Zyber turned back towards her den with a heavy step, feeling every one of 
her muscles complain and protest as she moved.

By the time she reached her den the storm had nearly died down, entering 
into the warmth and safety of her home...covered in snow.
Walking into the shadows she came to the enterence of her bed chamber, 
looking in to see just how Blaster(DeathSkythe) was.

Seeing that everything was alright she moved on to the main chamber, where 
tones of quartze crystls hun from the cieling and sprouted up from the 
floor.
There was already a warm fire burning over to the right of the room, and the 
plunked herself down near it and shook herself. Spatters of snow hitting the 
flames and hissing as they mented.*
